answers.answer: I'm in the exact same boat as you!! 24 wks and 2 lbs. If you were already carrying extra weight prior to the pregnancy, you're not supposed to gain nearly as much! Don't stress, your midwife will take the appropriate course of action!

Dont worry! If the doctor didnt say anything to you..you are fine. I wasnt overweight before I got pregnant and everyone told me I was suppose to be gaining more than I was. I am 34 1/2 weeks and I think I gained between 5-7 pounds. The doctor said baby and I are both healthy. But, everyone is different. I know I eat a lot healthier than I did before I was pregnant and I also stick with a workout plan just modify it the bigger I get haha..you are good:)

Im not as far along as you but im 17 weeks and havent gained a single pound. My obgyn didnt express concern since my urine/blood tests came back fine and im eating/drinking well. Everyone is different
I am 23weeks and lost 15lbs as long as baby is growing right your fine.

Im 33 weeks and weigh less than my pre-pregnancy weight by 7 lbs. My doctors are not concerned about it as they have been monitoring my baby girl's growth through ultrasounds every 2 weeks. It just proves to them that I am truly regulating my gestational diabetes with diet and light exercise.

I didn't gain anything until I hit 24 weeks and in a month I gained 12lbs. The last week I didn't even gain. Everyone's body is different as is every pregnancy. I wouldn't worry too much unless your dr seems concerned.

question: Im 24 week today and I have only put on 4 pound since I have been pregnant!! Youre ment to put on almost a stone by now,as im more than half way. Does anyone else know if this is ok? Should I be worrying ? I see my midwife next weekend will she send me to hospital ?
title: not putting on weight
